descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
In the ADVT 311, 312, 313 sequence, students interested in pursuing a career in advertising copywriting or art direction learn the skills needed to obtain positions in this highly competitive field. Students work with partners under the guidance of a team of creative professionals. At the end of the sequence, students should have an interview-ready portfolio. Students are also split into small groups and introduced to various applications they will need to succeed in the business. The basics of Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Flash and Dreamweaver are covered. Periodically, advertising professionals lecture on other areas of the industry, including strategic planning, account management and commercial production.

In ADVT 313, the focus will be on refining your work even further, so by the end of the quarter you will be ready to send it out to creative directors. Prior to doing so, you will have the opportunity to have your work critiqued by advertising professionals. Work developed should be suitable for portfolio presentation. In addition, you will receive assistance in creating an online portfolio to showcase your work. May not be audited. Enrollment is limited. Prerequisite: ADVT 311, 312.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: ADVT 311, 312.
This course takes place at the DDB advertising agency: DDB Chicago, 200 East Randolph, 40th floor, Chicago, 60601.
